summary: An interview with Keith Wilson, a candidate for the Portland City Council Position 4, discussing his political platform, education, and views on city management and law enforcement.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to a blue background featuring the League of Women Voters of Portland logo, accompanied by a red and white striped border and stars. The text "ELECTION 2020" appears on a blue banner with a red star and white stripes. The scene then shifts to a man in a light blue shirt and dark tie, wearing earphones, seated in an office with bookshelves and framed certificates in the background. A lower third graphic introduces him as Chris Cobey, a member of the League of Women Voters of Portland, with the organization's website listed. The video then shows a split-screen view of two men, both in light blue shirts, with the text "Video Voters' Guide" and the League of Women Voters of Portland logo displayed at the bottom. The scene transitions to a close-up of the second man, identified as Keith Wilson, a candidate for Portland City Commissioner District 4, with the same lower third graphic. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, focusing on the individuals and their roles in the election process.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a dramatic musical piece, featuring a triumphant fanfare and strings, creating a mood of anticipation. Transitioning into speech, a male voice introduces himself as Chris Kobe with the League of Women Voters of Portland, setting up a video voters guide. He welcomes Keith Wilson, a candidate for the Portland City Council, and asks him to introduce himself and his reasons for running. Keith Wilson responds with a warm greeting and thanks to the League of Women Voters, before expressing concern for the current crisis and best wishes to everyone. He assures that, together, they will get through it.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a printer visible in the background. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The office setting includes a filing cabinet, a globe, and framed pictures on the wall. At one point, a logo with the letters "LWV" appears in the bottom left corner of the screen, and later, a banner with the text "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org" is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The video then transitions to a split-screen view, showing two men in separate office settings, both wearing light blue shirts. The man on the left is in a room with bookshelves and framed pictures, while the man on the right is in the same office as the initial scene. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the focus on the individuals speaking and the context provided by the office environment and on-screen text.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a man introducing himself as Keith Wilson, stating he was born and raised in Portland. He shares about his family life, mentioning his wife and children, and his educational background at Roosevelt High School and Oregon State. He then describes leaving Portland for many years to travel and work overseas, after which he returned to join his father's business in transportation. He's currently the President of Titan Freight Systems. He continues to describe his wife as an early childhood special education teacher, and says that his kids are doing great. Finally, he mentions he is going to share about some of his focus.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, each in their respective environments. The man on the left is dressed in a light blue shirt and dark tie, seated in a room with a bookshelf and framed pictures in the background. The man on the right, also in a light blue shirt, is in an office setting with a window, blinds, and a filing cabinet behind him. The "MetroEast" logo is visible in the bottom right corner. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man on the right, identified by on-screen text as "Keith Wilson, Candidate Portland City Commissioner District 4," with the "LWV" logo accompanying the text. The video maintains a professional atmosphere, focusing on the conversation between the two individuals.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins by describing four key tenets, starting with "our inability to keep our city clean and maintained". He states his expertise as a transportation manager and owner and mentions concerns about homelessness with a plan to address it. He then discusses climate crisis, noting his company, Titan, uses green technology, and he wants to apply that on a larger scale to Portland. His tone is confident and solution-oriented.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, characterized by a window with blinds, a black filing cabinet, and a globe on top of it. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as indicated by his facial expressions and hand gestures. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, introducing another man in a similar light blue shirt and dark tie, seated in a different setting with bookshelves and framed pictures in the background. Both men seem to be participating in a video call or interview, with the split-screen format allowing for a direct comparison of their environments and interactions. The video maintains a professional atmosphere throughout, with both individuals appearing focused and engaged in their discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker discussing a "deeply affordable housing crisis," emphasizing the struggle for people who have lived or built the city to afford living there. He mentions having "clear-cut plans" to address it. This is one of the main reasons he's running for Portland City Council.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, each in their respective office environments. The man on the left is dressed in a light blue shirt and a dark tie, seated in a room with a bookshelf and framed pictures in the background. The man on the right, also in a light blue shirt, is in an office with a window, blinds, and a filing cabinet. Throughout the video, the men appear to be engaged in a conversation, with the man on the left occasionally gesturing with his hands. A banner at the bottom of the screen displays the text "LWY Vote411.org lwvpxd.org," indicating a possible political or civic discussion. The video concludes with the "MetroEast" logo appearing in the bottom right corner, suggesting the involvement of a media outlet or organization. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused on the discussion at hand.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker referring to the pandemic as "a major challenge," and further asks, with a tone of concern, about the challenges resulting from it. He references layoffs, devastating small businesses, and repercussions for months and years. A second male speaker begins, speaking more calmly, indicating he will discuss the pandemic.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a black filing cabinet in the background. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. At one point, a text overlay appears at the bottom of the screen, reading "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwpxd.org," indicating that the video is likely part of a voter education initiative by the League of Women Voters of Portland. The man's demeanor remains professional and focused, suggesting that he is delivering information or instructions related to the guide. The office setting is consistent throughout the video, with no significant changes in the background or the man's position.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a single male speaker discussing the small business stabilization fund and emphasizing the need for "all hands on deck". He expresses concerns about a potential recession and the importance of investing in the workforce. His tone is serious and focused. A faint, gentle sound of wind appears subtly in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window and blinds in the background, a printer, and a filing cabinet with a globe and framed pictures on top. He appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with his facial expressions and hand gestures indicating he is engaged in a conversation or presentation. A text overlay appears at the bottom of the screen, reading "LWV Keith Wilson Candidate Portland City Commissioner District 4," identifying the man as a political candidate. The setting remains consistent throughout the video, with the man continuing to speak and gesture, maintaining a professional and focused atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker enthusiastically describing his experience at Portland Community College, mentioning attending after Roosevelt High School and paying for his own education. He believes it's time to retrain and turn the current crisis—which he describes as both danger and opportunity—into a positive. He emphasizes converting the crisis into opportunity.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a black filing cabinet in the background. He appears to be engaged in a conversation, as indicated by his facial expressions and gestures. The office setting includes a globe and framed pictures on the cabinet, adding a personal touch to the workspace. At one point, the video transitions to a split-screen view, showing the man alongside another individual in a different setting, suggesting a video call or interview. The second person is also dressed in a light blue shirt and is seated in a room with bookshelves and framed pictures on the wall. The video then returns to the original man, who continues to speak, with a text overlay appearing at the bottom of the screen. The overlay reads "LWV Vote411.org lwvpxd.org," indicating a connection to the League of Women Voters and providing website information for further engagement. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is discussing topics related to voting or civic engagement, as implied by the text overlay. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the man's attire and the office setting reinforcing the formal context of the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a male speaker discussing the need for government support, local, regional, and national, to retrain the workforce in response to a recession. He advocates for constant evolution, readiness, and utilizing city resources to help businesses survive, ultimately aiding the workforce. Following this, another male speaker responds with a simple acknowledgement, "Okay". The audio concludes with the word "Ellen".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, each in their respective office environments. The man on the left is wearing a light blue shirt and a dark tie, while the man on the right is dressed in a light blue shirt. Both men are seated in front of their desks, with various office items visible in the background, such as bookshelves, framed pictures, and office equipment. The man on the left appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and the presence of earphones, while the man on the right listens attentively. The video includes a logo in the bottom left corner with the letters "LWV," which stands for League of Women Voters, suggesting that the conversation may be related to civic or community topics. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused, with both individuals engaged in a serious discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing a discussion about "city government" and noting an "unusual situation." He then inquires about bureaus the listener might be interested in managing if they were a city council member. Another male speaker agrees with what has been stated.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two men engaged in a video call, each situated in their respective office environments. The man on the left is dressed in a light blue shirt and tie, seated in a room with bookshelves and framed pictures on the wall, while the man on the right, also in a light blue shirt, is in an office with a window, blinds, and a filing cabinet. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man on the right, who appears to be speaking, with a text overlay reading "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwpxd.org" (indicating the video is part of a guide produced by the League of Women Voters of Portland). The man continues to speak, with the background remaining consistent, featuring the window, blinds, and filing cabinet. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, focusing on the man's discussion related to the League of Women Voters of Portland.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with someone saying "yes, in fact," followed by an individual who claims to be running for position number four. This person has a master's degree in transportation and finance and ran a complex transportation organization for the past 20 years. They mention being into green transportation, knowing all the facets of running a trucking company, and being a perfect fit. The speaker concludes that the commission and PBOT work perfectly.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a black filing cabinet in the background. He appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with his facial expressions and mouth movements indicating that he is engaged in a conversation or presentation. Throughout the video, a banner with the text "LWV Vote411.org lwvpxd.org" is displayed at the bottom of the screen, suggesting that the man is discussing topics related to voting or civic engagement. The office setting is professional, with a globe and framed pictures on the filing cabinet, adding to the formal atmosphere. The man's demeanor remains consistent, with slight variations in his facial expressions and gestures as he continues to speak.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the "former city government," arguing that although some individuals like a nurse running the water bureau may be talented, it's inefficient for them to learn technical aspects like pipe sizes when their expertise lies in chemistry and biology. He advocates for a "structured city manager" with expertise in management techniques like key performance indicators and Six Sigma to manage bureau heads and report to the city, suggesting this would be a more effective approach.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a black filing cabinet in the background. The logo "MetroEast" is visible in the bottom right corner. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and hand gestures. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing the same man on the right side and another man in a similar light blue shirt and tie on the left side, suggesting a video call or interview. The background of the second man includes a bookshelf and framed pictures. The video then returns to the original scene of the first man in the office, continuing his speech. The overall atmosphere is professional, with a focus on the man's communication.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, seemingly discussing a city's organizational structure and policy-making process with an optimistic tone, saying council people are "legislators" who "focus 100% of our time" on "developing the best policy" and that "the city has nothing to hold it back" if managed well. Another speaker interjects with "very good".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, each in their respective office environments. The man on the left is wearing a light blue shirt and a dark tie, while the man on the right is dressed in a light blue shirt. Both men are seated in front of their computer screens, with the man on the left in a room with bookshelves and framed pictures on the wall, and the man on the right in an office with a window, blinds, and a filing cabinet. Throughout the video, the men appear to be engaged in a conversation, with the man on the left gesturing with his hands and the man on the right listening attentively. The logo "LWV" is visible in the bottom left corner of the screen, indicating the organization involved in the video call. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused, with both men maintaining a serious demeanor as they discuss their topic.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker requesting one more question, followed by him asking for general comments on law enforcement in the city, specifically addressing police-community relations, use of deadly force, and officer accountability. The same male speaker then requests any thoughts on those topics.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, both dressed in light blue shirts. The man on the left is wearing a tie and has earphones in, while the man on the right is seated in an office with a window, blinds, and a globe in the background. The man on the right is identified as Keith Wilson, a candidate for Portland City Commissioner District 4, as indicated by the text overlay at the bottom of the screen. The video transitions to a close-up of Keith Wilson, who appears to be speaking directly to the camera. The background remains consistent, showing the office setting with the window and blinds, and the globe is still visible. The atmosphere is professional, and the focus is on Keith Wilson as he addresses the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker expressing sadness over a heart-wrenching situation, particularly mentioning the involvement of "mentally ill" individuals in instances of "deadly force," linking this to homelessness. He proceeds to reference a website "Keithforportland.com," highlighting platform items addressing mental illness and homelessness.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a black filing cabinet in the background. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The office setting includes a globe and framed pictures on the cabinet, adding a personal touch to the professional atmosphere. At one point, a banner appears at the bottom of the screen with the text "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwpxd.org," indicating that the video is likely related to a political or civic topic. The man's gestures and expressions suggest he is engaged in delivering information or a message to the audience. The overall atmosphere is formal and informative, with the man's attire and the office setting reinforcing the professional context of the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing accountability and community-engaged policing. He describes the current program as temporary and expresses the need to make it full-time. He wants the program to have the ability to hold individuals accountable and research transgressions completely. His tone is serious and professional. He mentions the desire for the program to be permanent and integrated into the city structure.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment. He appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by his facial expressions and slight movements. The office setting includes a window with blinds, a printer, and a filing cabinet. On top of the filing cabinet, there is a globe and a framed picture, adding a personal touch to the workspace. The man's demeanor suggests he is focused and possibly explaining or discussing a topic. The overall atmosphere is professional and calm, with the man as the central figure in the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker advocating for an oversight program, stating the need to "look and hold everybody accountable," and emphasizes supporting both the police and the public. He stresses that "it has to work together to really make Portland safer" and concludes by wanting to "make Portland safer". The overall tone is serious and focused on public safety.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen video call between two men, both dressed in light blue shirts, with one wearing a tie. They are engaged in a conversation, with the man on the left gesturing with his hands. The background of the man on the left includes a bookshelf and framed pictures, while the man on the right is in an office setting with a window and blinds. The video transitions to a close-up of the man on the left, who continues to speak. The scene then shifts to a blue screen with white text that reads "League of Women Voters of Portland Presents The Video Voters' Guide," along with the website "Vote411.org" and "lwvpdx.org." The video continues with another blue screen displaying the text "League of Women Voters of Portland Don't forget to cast your ballot! Primary Election May 19th," followed by the same website information. The final frames show a blue screen with white text thanking various foundations for their support, including the Multnomah Bar Foundation, Carol & Velma Saling Foundation, Vernier Software & Technology, and The Wyss Foundation. The video concludes with a screen displaying the logo of MetroEast.org and a Creative Commons license notice.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker expressing appreciation, followed by a reference to taking time and "rolling with the punches." He then identifies the content as the "Visio Voters Guide" and mentions the primary election date, emphasizing the importance of being informed about candidates and ballot measures, and exercising the right to vote. The speaker concludes with a thank you for watching. This speech segment is followed by dramatic music.
